document_data.mainbody:
The Old Archers Eye was a trading collective in Arrowmark that sold arrows and bows.
The shop was a trading collective established by the best bowyers and fletchers in the area. It was a popular shop, with dozens of daily buyers, who were met with the shops distinct and pleasant scent of cedar combined with the smell of various oils and varnishes. The work of each bower and fletcher was clearly marked and placed in its own case of glass. 
Due to the high quality of craftsmanship, the shop was expensive. The cost of a bow usually began at 125 gp and a single arrow 1 sp. Custom bows could be ordered but took longer to manufacture and were much more expensive, with costs beginning at 200 gp.
